intro: Poitea florida, commonly known as the Florida poitea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetlands and swampy areas, thriving in moist, acidic soils. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in clusters, and bloom in the spring. Poitea florida is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
